info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 8:17PM CDT until July 21 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Nuckolls and Thayer.
* WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 812 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area due to heavy rain and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Blue River, Little Sandy Creek, Republican River, South Fork Big Sandy Creek, Crosby Creek, Spring Branch, Thawes Creek, Lost Creek, Spring Creek, Walnut Creek, Oak Creek, Dry Creek, Big Sandy Creek, Humphrey Branch Rose Creek, Rose Creek, Balls Branch Rose Creek and Dry Sandy Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Superior, Hebron, Deshler, Bruning, Chester, Alexandria, Hardy, Ruskin, Carleton, Byron, Hubbell, Belvidere and Gilead. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING
